title.rendered: Horseheads School District potentially cutting 49 jobs

content.rendered:
HORSEHEADS, N.Y. (WETM) – “Hearts and emotions are very much heightened and I understand that. These are our friends, these are our neighbors, these are our community members.”

On April 4, a large number of concerned parents, teachers and community members attended the Horseheads School District budget workshop.

The proposed budget would cut an estimated 49 positions and funding to some extracurricular activities. Many people spoke out against those cuts.

“The biggest concern about losing my position is what’s going to happen to the children of the horseheads community,” said one teacher.

“You take away our nurses, our teacher aides. Like, that is all going to affect our kids and fall into our laps again,” said another teacher.

“I truly believe we need to make those positions a priority and protect our most vulnerable students. Our students with special needs,” said a special needs teacher.

Superintendent Dr. Thomas Douglas says these cuts are due to a multitude of reasons.

“With the end of a pandemic. With the renegotiation of healthcare contracts outside of the district, not with us that has chosen to show itself of almost a $4 million plus increase in healthcare alone. Not to mention the other inflationary impacts,” said Douglas. 

He also says the district has exhausted its options to lower a three million dollar deficit.

“We had to start notifying unfortunately staff that potential jobs could be in jeopardy. But even during that time, we are tonight showing what potential reductions would need to be made in the district to balance the gap, which we’re obligated to do.”

Douglas says the community has the power to make a change.

“Ultimately, only the community sets the direction for the district. The board can sit there and say we’re going at two percent. The board can sit there and say we don’t want to make these cuts or we’ve made some cuts. We want to challenge or the board can say we don’t think the community will support it and we want to go below; which means we may have to make more reductions,” said Douglas.

No decision will be made on these budget cuts until the tentative date of April 18.
